sections.section_title: Short title, extent and commencement
sections.body: (1) This Act may be called the Public Debt Act, 1944. (2) It extends to the whole of Pakistan. (3) It shall come into force on such date as the Federal Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, appoint in this behalf.

sections.section_title: Definitions
sections.body: In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the subject or context, - (1) 'the Bank' means the State Bank of Pakistan. (1A) 'Government', in relation to Government security, means the Federal or Provincial Government by whom the security is created and issued; (2) 'Government security' means a security, created and issued, whether before or after the commencement of this Act, by Government for the purpose of raising a public loan.

sections.section_title: Transfer of Government securities
sections.body: (1) Subject to the provisions of section 5, a transfer of a Government security shall be made only in the manner prescribed for the making of transfers of securities of the class to which it belongs.

sections.section_title: Transferor of Government securities not liable for amount thereof
sections.body: Notwithstanding anything contained in the Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881, a person shall not, by reason only of his having transferred a Government security, be liable to pay any money due either as Principal or as interest there under.

sections.section_title: Holding of Government securities by holders of public offices
sections.body: (1) In the case of any public office to which Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, declare this sub-section to apply, a Government security in the form of stock or of a promissory note may be held in the name of the office.

sections.section_title: Notice of trust not receivable
sections.body: (1) No notice of any trust in respect of any Government security shall be receivable by Government nor shall Government be bound by any such notice even though expressly given.

sections.section_title: Persons whose title to a Government security of a deceased sole holder may be recognised by the Bank
sections.body: Subject to the provisions of section 9 the executors or administrators of a deceased sole holder of a Government security and the holder of a succession certificate issued under Part X of the Succession Act, 1925, shall be the only persons who may be recognised by the Bank as having any title to the Government security.

sections.section_title: Right of survivors of joint holders of several payees
sections.body: Notwithstanding anything contained in section 45 of the Contract Act, when a Government security is held by two or more persons jointly and either or any of them dies, the title to the security shall vest in the survivor or survivors of those persons.

sections.section_title: Summary procedure on death of holder of Government securities
sections.body: The procedure for handling the death of a holder of Government securities shall be as prescribed.
